title: How to Find Saved Audio Messages on an iPhone

steps.title: Open the message that contains an audio recording.
steps.content: Open the message that contains an audio recording. This only works on phones with iOS 12 and newer. Older iPhones will not save audio messages in Messages. To find audio messages on phones older than iOS 12, look in the Voice Memos app . You'll need to save your audio message within 2 minutes of listening so it doesn't expire. If you don't want audio messages to expire automatically, you can disable that feature in your settings.

steps.title: Tap Keep.
steps.content: Tap Keep . This is in blue text below the message in Messages. You'll see this option as long as it's been less than 2 minutes since you first listened to the audio message . [1] X Research source

steps.title: Find your audio messages in the Messages app.
steps.content: Find your audio messages in the Messages app. By scrolling through the chat conversation, you'll find all the messages that you saved by tapping Keep . [2] X Research source By default, you can raise the iPhone to your ear to listen to audio messages. If your iPhone's Messages are synced with iCloud , you can listen to the voice text on your Mac as well in Messages. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Open Settings on your iPhone.
steps.content: Open Settings on your iPhone. Tap the app icon featuring a set of gears on a light grey background. [4] X Research source By default, messages expire after 2 minutes and are forever gone, but you can change that! Changing this setting will allow you to save audio messages indefinitely.

steps.title: Tap Messages.
steps.content: Tap Messages . It's next to an icon of a speech bubble on a green background. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Expire.
steps.content: Tap Expire . You'll see this under the "Audio Messages" header. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Never to select it.
steps.content: Tap Never to select it. Now saved audio messages won't expire. [7] X Research source This will not restore audio messages that previously expired. Any expired messages have been deleted and are permanently gone. Keep in mind that saving lots of audio messages indefinitely will also take up a lot of room on your phone. The default feature to let messages expire after 2 minutes is to help you not run out of room .

steps.title: Open the text message that contains the audio you want to keep.
steps.content: Open the text message that contains the audio you want to keep. You can move audio messages to other apps, including Files, Notes, and iCloud Drive.

steps.title: Tap and hold the audio message.
steps.content: Tap and hold the audio message. When you see the "Options" menu at the bottom of your screen, you can let go of the message.

steps.title: Tap Copy.
steps.content: Tap Copy . It's usually the third item down in the menu next to an icon of two identical pieces of paper. The message is copied to your clipboard.

steps.title: Open another app like Files or Notes.
steps.content: Open another app like Files or Notes. If you opened the Notes app, create a new note . If you opened the Files app, select a folder in which to paste the audio message.

steps.title: Tap and hold your screen and select Paste.
steps.content: Tap and hold your screen and select Paste . The audio message will paste into that app! With the Files app, you can simply open the app and navigate to this folder to listen to the audio message any time you'd like. If you pasted the audio message in Notes, you can stop there or export that note anywhere! To share it, tap the three-dot menu icon in the top right corner and select how you want to share it.
